location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 5393/41 'Persia - G. I's complaint that telegrams repeated to them have no "priority" marking'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between the Government of India's External Affairs Department and the Secretary of State for India regarding delayed telegrams related to the Persian situation.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for India and Burma, United Kingdom
